subject: Psychology
title: The Sunk Cost Fallacy
description: Learn The Sunk Cost Fallacy in one minute.

hook.text: You've watched two hours of a terrible movie. You stay because you've already 'invested' the time.

buildup.text: The sunk cost fallacy is continuing something because of past investment, not future value.

discovery.text: Rational decisions should only consider future costs and benefits. Past spending is irrelevant.

twist.text: Companies throw millions at failing projects because executives can't admit the money was wasted.

climax.text: The courage to walk away from a bad investment â€” time, money, or effort â€” is the rational move.

punchline.text: What you've spent is gone. Only the future matters.

quiz.question: What is the sunk cost fallacy?
options: Continuing due to past investment rather than future value
